inclusion.criterion: Histologic or cytologic diagnosis of adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Resectable primary tumor of the head, body or tail of the pancreas defined as a visible mass in the pancreas and:
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A patent superior mesenteric (SMV)- portal vein (PV) confluence (assuming the technical ability to resect and reconstruct this venous confluence if needed)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: A definable tissue plane between the tumor and regional arterial structures including the celiac axis, common hepatic artery, and SMA.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Confirmation of resectability by surgical oncology consultation.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Presentation at a multidisciplinary conference at either University of Chicago or NorthShore University
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: No previous therapy for pancreatic cancer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Short removable metal stents rather than plastic stents are preferred but not required for palliation of initial obstructive jaundice
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have had previous chemotherapy or radiotherapy for pancreatic adenocarcinoma prior to entering the study.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Pathologic subtypes other than pure adenocarcinoma; acinar cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, spindle cell carcinoma, neuroendocrine cancer, and mixed types are not eligible.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are receiving any investigational agents.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients with borderline resectable, locally advanced or metastatic disease.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of CAD and recently noted abdominal mass. She presents with fevers/rigors and bandemia. CT abdomen without contrast showed a large heterogeneous left upper abdominal mass consistent with pancreatic adenocarcinoma at the head of pancreas.
